snippet: The new rule will eliminate a statewide exam given last year, and comes amid complaints that public high school students have to take too many tests.
abstract: State of Connecticut, responding to complaints that students are subjected to too many tests in 11th grade, eliminates statewide exam and makes SAT college admissions test mandatory; SAT will be administered without cost to students.
lead_paragraph: The new rule will eliminate a statewide exam given last year, and comes amid complaints that public high school students have to take too many tests.

headline.main: Connecticut to Require All 11th Graders to Take the SAT
headline.print_headline: Connecticut Will Require All 11th Graders to Take SAT
